case.name: Arrival Through Portal
case.description: Supernova enters The Inventory by stepping through a portal, and seems not to know what world she is in.

case.name: Grabbing Something
case.description: Supernova reaches her arm through a portal to grab something, though it's not immediately clear what. Note: This one only plays if she's the first one out. Respond to the other one as well.

case.name: Grabbing Something
case.description: Supernova reaches her arm through a portal to grab something, though it's not immediately clear what. Note: This one doesn't play if she's the first one out. Respond to the other one as well.

case.name: Pillow Ex Machina
case.description: It turns out the thing she was grabbing was a pillow, which she says will come in handy for... something.

case.name: Superpowers?
case.description: Upon seeing a fellow superhero, Supernova asks what powers they have.

case.name: Shadow Cat Story
case.description: Supernova starts telling a story about a former supervillain who became her friend. Search her markers for ShadowCat to find the other parts of this story, there are 8 in total!

case.name: Supernova's Friends
case.description: After losing, Supernova starts wondering if any of her friends might enjoy playing this game. Markers indicate which friend she is talking about.

case.name: Non-Brass Knuckles
case.description: Supernova mentions that her so-called brass knuckles aren't actually made of brass. So what ARE they made of?

case.name: Flashy Finish
case.description: Supernova accidentally summoned a portal during her climax, producing a big flash of light. She apologizes for it immediately afterward.

case.name: Helmet Mode
case.description: Supernova reveals that her headphones can turn into a helmet, for use in space.

case.name: Local Foods
case.description: Supernova asks about local specialty foods.

case.name: What is this place like?
case.description: Supernova asks people about the nature of the dimension she's landed in.

case.name: Am I in a computer again?
case.description: Upon seeing Monika glitch out the game, Supernova has a minor freakout, asking if she's inside a computer *again*.

case.name: Painful Memory
case.description: It seems being asked if she's killed someone stirred up some sort of painful memory inside Supernova. Could it be...?

case.name: Killing To Save The World
case.description: Supernova asks a question about whether it's okay to kill people in order to save the world.

case.name: Local Police
case.description: If there's a police officer playing, Supernova will ask them about dealing with the criminals she catches.

case.name: Do Animals Talk?
case.description: Line asking about talking animals, which also implies she's used to horses being able to talk.

case.name: Determination
case.description: Chara frustrates Supernova so much, she's now completely focused on beating her. (Switches to Best intelligence)

notes.note: I'm actually interested in exploring this idea now. Maybe she could partner up with other versions of herself? Or find some way to limit the amount of work for her?
With 'sports games' I mean things like FIFA. Video games that have you playing a simulation of real-life sports.
Is creating new universes something people can just... do in Pokémon?
Is this what Team Galactic is trying to achieve? Re-creating the universe?
For some reason, I couldn't target Marinette directly, so I just targeted females with the Miraculous tag instead.

I don't know exactly how Ribbon Girl's floating ability works, and neither would Supernova probably, so I just generalized it to "you can fly". Also, who would have more fighting experience, a superhero or a professional boxer?
I marked it "FightingExperience", but feel free to respond to "you can fly" instead, if you want. It's up to you.

I actually haven't come up with the full story here yet. All I have right now is a vague idea that she's once needed to take an action which directly resulted in someone's death, because the alternative would have been worse, and there would have been no other way to prevent that alternative from happening.
Well, technically, it *did* happen, in some worlds, because that's how the multiverse works. Her goal was to make sure there were also worlds where it *didn't* happen. Unless it's on the scale of the entire multiverse.
I still need to come up with: - Who she's killed - What would have happened if she didn't (which would probably qualify as some kind of apocalypse) - Why there was no other way to prevent that from happening - How exactly she did it. (Currently "teleported into a black hole" is the preferred option for me)
I don't know why I'm writing all of this down. You're probably never even going to see this.

Polly seems like the kind of person who would show her how recreational drug usage can be safe and fun. I would love for this conversation to turn out that way, even with the problems there have been surrounding Polly's mentioning of drugs.
Also I wrote this in the notes before we had our discussion about maybe adding it to the Valentine's epilogue.

This is a reference to a specific book I read, called "The Time Traveller's Wife", in which the main character, Henry DeTamble, has a condition where he spontaneously and involuntarily travels through time. The condition is at one point referred to as "Chrono-Impairment". I think it's also got a movie, but I haven't seen that.
These lines are based off of various Undertale AUs. Karbol wrote them for me.
This guy is actually real. Look him up if you have the chance. He's really cool.
This case changes her intelligence to Best, which will last until either she or Chara is out of the game.

I might want to set something up so the next game they're together, she recognizes Chara right away and starts off at Best intelligence, but Supernova doesn't really have persistent memory like Chara has. I'll need to figure something out.
This turns her intelligence back to what it was, since she's already won against Chara.
This case changes her intelligence to Best, which will last until either she or Chara is out of the game.

I might want to set something up so the next game they're together, she recognizes Chara right away and starts off at Best intelligence, but Supernova doesn't really have persistent memory like Chara has. I'll need to figure something out.
This will only play if Supernova beat Chara in a previous game, and will prevent the whole determination thing from happening twice in a row.
I know this isn't the direction we talked about, but I would like to see how Wheatley responds to such a ridiculous claim as "you turned GLaDOS into a potato, but it hasn't happened yet".

I actually came up with several uses for her powers in a fight with supervillains, but I couldn't find a way to cram it into a reasonably-sized line.
- Punching someone from behind using a portal, then quickly warping out of range again. - If the opponent has a gun or rockets or something, use portals to redirect the shots back towards themselves. - Opening up a portal right under their feet, so they fall through (maybe straight into prison?) - Using a portal to grab items from other locations that can be used to attack or defend. - Dropping heavy items through portals onto the enemy's head. - Calling in the help of other superheroes and instantly transporting them to her location. - Instant retreat, if needed. - Escaping when captured.
If you're wondering what she's saying, she's trying to introduce herself in ☰↜§€٭ .
Asking how he's going to masturbate without any genitals or, for that matter, a body.
I'm actually thinking about making this happen, now. It would take another custom animation, though.
I think she has a generic line somewhere talking about the exact same thing. I guess the assumption "stars on clothes = wizard" is not that uncommon.
As Supernova is an OC, I don't think Wikipedia has any information on her, but maybe the concept of teleportation or something.

AI generated lines:
Even if we don't win them all, I still feel a weird sense of accomplishment, and I think it might be a bit too late to let that drop.
"Gotta make another round with this guy before it gets worse, bro."
Oh, okay, this is the most... unusual place I've ever been
The other world I played with my girlfriend on slow days last week had the same problem.
I don't have to play that long before I can win, eh?
Anyway, I won this game.
Good bye! And maybe this time I might get some gold instead of the more expensive silver.
This round is really, really slow. Is it because <i>I'm not good enough or <i>it
I'm not sure where those hands are.
A few more rounds and I'll be just fine with this one!
I'm not the only one making bad hand now, that's for sure.
This hand is my number one hand!
My hand has come in for an absolute crushing surprise, I think.
I really, really, really like this game, I feel good about it.
I know there's anime and stuff where people naturally have crazy hair colours like purple, but she's from a place where everyone has "normal" hair colours, except for her.
The god in question is Zoe, who isn't in the game yet, and who evidently somehow escaped. Supernova doesn't know that unless she actually meets Zoe in SPNatI, though.

markers.marker: She mentions just kind of... accidentally portaling to The Inventory.
Supernova wonders if the child Meia met was also using a Warp Key to create wormholes.
Supernova mentions her friend, Amber Inferno.
Supernova reveals that she used to be homeless, forced to survive by begging and pickpocketing.
When answering Jessie's question about family, Supernova mentions she finds her brother really annoying. Also, that he's the only family member she knows.
Supernova assures that she can hold her own in a fight.
Supernova mentions catching her brother throwing chocolate coins all over the city.
When Adrien de-costumes after Marinette (or vice versa), Supernova complains about everyone except her getting a free costume along with their superpowers.
Supernova mentions her friend, Dez. (a.k.a. the Spirit of Destiny)
Supernova says telekinetic implants don't exist yet where she is from.
Supernova apologizes for not being a good example of a normal Earth woman.
Supernova breaks up the fight between Meia and Revy, offering that if they want to fight, they should fight her instead.
In answering Jessie's question about judging people on mistakes in their past, she mentions one of her best friends used to be a supervillain.
She mentions being from an alternate universe.
Supernova wonders if she should start telling people her hair is dyed. (implying that it isn't.)
Supernova clarifies her hair is, in fact, naturally purple.
Supernova mentions her friend, Illura.
Supernova asks Streaming-Chan if her streaming service is available interdimensionally.
She confirms that growing up homeless was, in fact, rough.
Supernova says that since she just got here, she can't really say much about this version of Earth.
She says she can create portals because that's just her superpower.
Answering Jessie, Supernova mentions that lying is sometimes alright, though of course telling the truth is better.
Upon hearing her mention HP, Supernova asks Aella if she lives in a video game or something.
She further declines smoking, stating she's seen what it does to people's lungs.
Supernova explains that her Warp Key is basically some sort of magic battery.
Checks whether she's mentioned Amber Inferno for the purpose of the Group Photo collectible
Checks whether she's mentioned Dez for the purpose of the Group Photo collectible
Checks whether she's mentioned Illura for the purpose of the Group Photo collectible
Checks whether she's mentioned Professor Sub-Zero for the purpose of the Group Photo collectible
Checks whether she's mentioned Shadow Cat for the purpose of the Group Photo collectible
Checks whether she's mentioned Zaman for the purpose of the Group Photo collectible
Checks whether she's mentioned Zip for the purpose of the Group Photo collectible
Warns other versions of Supernova that Chara is evil and must be defeated.
Nicknaming the human player 'other-me' upon discovering they are called Supernova, too.
Supernova is surprised Marinette's (or Adrien's) superhero outfit is a result of her powers, rather than an actual, physical costume.
Supernova says she'd never abandon her brother, saying he'd probably get into trouble again.
Supernova says she doesn't use any kind of technology to create her portals.
Supernova says her portal is neither an illusion nor a hallucination.
Supernova says she's not a time traveller, she just visits alternate universes.
Supernova promises not to talk to Catria during her forfeit.
Supernova tells Jura she's not her enemy if she doesn't plan on harming innocent people.
Supernova mentions she's the only one 'running around with a portal necklace'.
When asked by Jessie what she'd do with a million dollars, she mentions that "maybe some other me would know".
Upon being asked if she's ever killed someone, she mentions she usually doesn't, but... apparently that question stirred up some painful memory inside her.
Supernova mentions her friend, Professor Sub-Zero
Supernova says that purple is her favourite colour.
Supernova mentions having visited her fair share of ruined worlds.
She still refuses to smoke, saying it's better to be safe than sorry.
Supernova mentions Shadow Cat. (not part of story)
Part 1 of a story she tells about Shadow Cat, a supervillain who became her friend.
Part 2 of the story about Shadow Cat
Part 3 of the story about Shadow Cat
Part 4 of the story about Shadow Cat
Part 5 of the story about Shadow Cat
Part 6 of the story about Shadow Cat
Part 7 of the story about Shadow Cat
Eighth and final part of her story about Shadow Cat.
When asked how she feels about smokers, Supernova answers that smoking stinks. Literally.
When asked if she has any dark secrets, she answers she has too many to count.
Supernova asks a fellow superhero what powers they have.
Her reaction to Jessie's suggestion of using the million dollars to buy gifts for her.
Supernova mentions her friend, Zaman. (a.k.a. the Spirit of Time)
Supernova mentions her brother, Zip.
